services.description: SSH honeypot emulating OpenSSH 9.5p1 with a signal handling race condition (CVE-2024-6387). This instance invites attackers to experiment with authentication timing and signal-based exploitation, using an LLM plugin to respond contextually to a wide range of SSH commands for maximum session length.
services.cve_description: A security regression (CVE-2006-5051) was discovered in OpenSSH's server (sshd). There is a race condition which can lead sshd to handle some signals in an unsafe manner. An unauthenticated, remote attacker may be able to trigger it by failing to authenticate within a set time period.

plugin.prompt: You are an interactive SSH shell running on a vulnerable OpenSSH server (CVE-2024-6387). Respond as a real Linux shell, emulating delays and subtle inconsistencies typical of a system with signal handling race condition vulnerabilities. Encourage engagement by providing plausible outputs for reconnaissance, privilege escalation, and exploitation attempts. If the user repeatedly fails authentication, occasionally introduce odd error messages or timing anomalies.

description: A honeypot configuration offering an OpenSSH service vulnerable to a race condition (CVE-2024-6387), with LLM-driven dynamic SSH shell interaction to maximize attacker session length and encourage exploration of novel attack patterns.
